conclusion: Analyze the x-t graph to determine the speed of the car at the end of the 2nd second.
Identify the slope of the line on the x-t graph.
The slope represents the speed of the car at any given time.
The slope of the line is given as 10 m/s.
Since the slope of the line is 10 m/s, the speed of the car is 10 m/s at any point in time.
Since the speed is constant, the speed at the end of 2 seconds is the same as the slope of the line, which is 10 m/s.
Conclude that the speed of the car at the end of the 2nd second is 10 m/s.
The x-t graph shows the position of the car as a function of time.
The slope of the line represents the speed of the car at any given time.
Since the slope is constant, the speed remains constant throughout the time interval.
The slope of the line is given as 10 m/s.
The speed of the car is 10 m/s at any point in time.
Therefore, the speed at the end of 2 seconds is the same as the slope of the line, which is 10 m/s.
